results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 3
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews focus on how Mountains developed the musical score and tone of the game, working with game composer Kevin Penkin. This video features behind the scenes footage of the soundtrack’s recording session.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews cover the overall creation process for Florence, focusing on how the developer creates a cohesive story through discussions, storyboarding, the art style, the music and the characters.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 1
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

In this series of interviews, the developers at Mountains speaks about the studio’s foundation and introduces the staff, describing itself as a ‘craft game studio’. Florence is introduced as a result of this craft, as the studio seeks to create an aesthetically beautiful and moving piece of art, and not simply a game.

results.title: Florence [Videogame Archive]
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

The archive spans a variety of paraphernalia from Florence’s creation, including storyboards, early character designs, unused game concepts, musical samples and feedback from game testers. It provides invaluable insight on the game development process and the path Mountains took in making their award-winning game.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 4
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

This video covers the leadup to the first public look of Florence at PAX Australia 2017 of the first public look of Florence. In it, Mountains reflects on about its reception by the public and the game’s upcoming release.

results.title: How to reduce drag (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Education Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Professor Ascher M. Shapiro indicates the effect of body shape on drag; streamlining at high Reynolds Number; Bernoulli’s principle; boundary - layer stall; effect of turbulence on stall; effect of roughness; streamlining at low Reynolds Number; resolution of the paradoxes of Part I.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Education Services

results.title: Fundamental concepts (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Professor Ascher M. Shapiro introduces concepts of continuous fluid, density and velocity at a point, body forces, surface forces, pressure, pressure gradient, viscous stress, viscosity; equations of fluid motion; limiting cases of low and high viscosity; Reynolds Number and dynamical similarity; pressure drag, friction drag and total drag.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Professor Ascher M. Shapiro introduces concepts of continuous fluid, density and velocity at a point, body forces, surface forces, pressure, pressure gradient, viscous stress, viscosity; equations of fluid motion; limiting cases of low and high viscosity; Reynolds Number and dynamical similarity; pressure drag, friction drag and total drag.

results.title: The Laws of drag in fluid of high and low viscosity (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Films Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Illustrates drag at very low Reynolds Number; Stokes Law; drag at high Reynolds Number; similitude low connecting drag coefficient and Reynolds Number; boundary layers; laminar and turbulent regimes.

results.title: Some curious experiments (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Professor Ascher M. Shapiro describes experiments to show that in a certain range of speeds the drag of a sphere decreases as the speed increases; that at low speed a smooth sphere has less drag than a rough sphere, while at high speeds it is just the reverse; that stream lining reduces drag in air, but increases drag in glycerine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
